page.title: 03Barnardiston Hall School
page.content: Barnardiston Hall became a school in 1970 when Mrs.S.A.Kiddy moved her existing school from Lawn Farm, Withersfield.Many new classrooms and other facilities have been converted from stables over the last fifteenn years, making the school popular for it's all round education. There are 130 day-pupils, aged 3-13, and as well as all academic subjecct,many extras are taught,by 10 full-time and 5 part-time staff. Special days in the school year are the Christmas Carol service,Sports Day and Prize-giving. Pupils often perform plays and musicals and take part in sporting challenges with other schools.
